## 1. AFFiNE


AFFiNE is a next-generation knowledge base that combines the best of Notion and Miro into one app. It is a powerful and flexible open-source tool that offers a wide range of features for note-taking, task management, and project collaboration.

It has a sleek and intuitive interface that makes it easy to use, and it's highly customizable to suit your needs.


One of the biggest advantages of AFFiNE over other Notion alternatives is its flexibility. You can use it for personal note-taking, team collaboration, project management, and more. It also offers advanced features like time tracking, data visualization, and automation. If you're looking for a powerful and flexible tool that can handle all your note-taking, task management, and project collaboration needs, then [AFFiNE](https://affine.pro/blog/affine-the-next-gen-knowledge-base-to-notion-and-miro) is definitely worth checking out.


## 2. Appflow


Appflowy is another great open-source Notion alternative that's worth checking out. It's a simple but powerful tool that's designed for note-taking and task management. It has a minimalist interface that's easy to navigate, and it's highly customizable to fit your workflow.


The biggest advantage of APPflowy lies in its Rust+Flutter technology architecture. This technology combination makes APPflowy perform better and its interface smoother and easier to use. In addition, the Rust+Flutter technology architecture also makes APPflowy more stable and secure, ensuring that your data is always protected. Although APPflowy is very simple and easy to use, it also offers many advanced features, such as Markdown support, tagging, encryption, and synchronization.


## 3. Turtl


Turtl is a secure and private open-source tool that's designed for note-taking and bookmarking. It has a strong focus on privacy and security, which makes it an excellent choice for sensitive information. It also offers a range of features like cross-device syncing, tagging, and encryption.


## 4. Joplin


Joplin is a powerful open-source tool that's designed for note-taking, to-do lists, and task management. It has a clean and modern interface that's easy to use, and it's highly customizable to fit your needs. It also offers advanced features like Markdown support, encryption, and synchronization.


## 5. Laverna


Laverna is a simple but powerful open-source tool that's designed for note-taking and task management. It has a clean and minimalist interface that's easy to use, and it's highly customizable to fit your workflow. It also offers advanced features like Markdown support, encryption, and synchronization.
